column4: I was curious if anyone else is using Ubuntu on a netbook with a resolution of 1024x600?
I have used it on a dell with 1024 resolution
did you notice that some system menus (such as the login window setting) dont fit on the netbook displays?
thats actually quite common, i had to first resize the desktop to lower than the standard (800x600) then enable the nvidia drivers i could use, then resize it back to my desired 1024
how do you do that?  I wouldnt know where to begin with that
system>prefrences>screen screen resoultion.
the lowest resolution I can set it to from there is 1024x600
lower the resoultion to 800x600 and it will "blow up the images" but they should fit on your screen to allow you to update your drivers package under system > administration> hardware drivers
theres no listing for under 1024
no there is not
one second let me google
kk
do you have any hardware drivers installed yet?
restricted ones i mean
yes.  I do.  the ones for my intel 950
looks like 1024 is the standard for the GMA 950 integrated
that is correct
could you go to system>administration>hardware drivers, and check that the recommended is active?
if its not active, activate the restricted drivers and reboot, see if your still having the errors.
actually, the intel graphics is not included in that list.  only the broadcom wireless drivers
looks like linux supports the intel intregrated 950 by default...
any other suggestions?
